learning_outcomes.description: Critically examine the significance of consultation, referral and a multidisciplinary approach to the care of women and neonates with critical illness in pregnancy labour and the puerperium, including rural and remote settings.
Analyse the aetiology, management and apply skills including monitoring, assessment and care of the woman and baby for a range of emergency situations in pregnancy, labour, birth and the puerperium.

Using contemporary and appropriate evidence, critically review the pathophysiology of, diagnosis, and evidence for treatment of, and expected outcomes associated with critical illness and life-threatening emergencies of significance to midwifery practice.

Analyse and critically review the contemporary and relevant evidence used to inform midwifery care of women with a critical illness or life-threatening emergency, with a particular focus on the use of digital health technology to improve health outcomes.

Advocate culturally responsive strategies to support women and their families as they are challenged by and deal with the physical and psychological complications of a critical illness or a life-threatening emergency in pregnancy, labour, birth and the puerperium.

assessments.due_date:
5/08/2024 - 25/10/2024

Please submit your Oral Presentation via the link provided in the assessment folder of the Blackboard course.
assessments.task_description:
Task: Oral Presentation 

Weighting: 40%

Due Date: Assigned IBL Classes August 5th -October 25th, 2024

Task Description: Your individual oral presentation topic will be generated as a course identified learning outcome or directly as a critical issue from the prior IBL session. Presentations from the previous IBL session will take place BEFORE the next IBL session and presented in class. Your 15-minute oral presentation will compose up to 40 marks for the subject. Time length of your presentation must be within +/- 10% of the allocated time. A time limit outside this 10% will result in 10% reduction of the total mark available. Please note presentations will be recorded for marking purposes.

Reference system: Slides must be referenced throughout using APA 7th edition or Vancouver.

Header: Student ID (eight digits), Course Code
assessments.submission_guidelines: This piece of assessment is to be submitted in the course Blackboard via the provided assessment link. By submitting your presentation, you are certifying that it is your original work and that where you have used the ideas or writing of other authors this has been acknowledged according to accepted academic guidelines.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Task: Exam  

Weighting: 60%

Due Date: Examination period

Task Description: This assessment will examine the learning objectives of the MIDW2105 course content. Questions will be derived from lecture content, readings, and provided course content. The exam will be, online invigilated on campus in this course using the Inspera Assessment Platform. Inspera Assessment provides additional functionality to complement the existing suite of digital learning tools at UQ with a greater range of question types and accessibility provisions. Further details, including an Inspera demo test to familiarise yourself with the functionality, and where to go for support can be found in the course companion Blackboard site.
